alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 1:32PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following area, Mono County. Portions of western Nevada, including the following area, Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Increased risks for flash flooding and debris flows in areas of steep terrain or in recent burn scar areas. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams could flood with heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A significant increase in tropical moisture originating from Hurricane Hilary could result in periods of moderate to heavy rainfall late this weekend into early next week. There will be an increased risk for rapid runoff and flash flooding potential. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
